description: A rare form of Haki that allows the user to exert their willpower over others, causing those with weak wills to lose consciousness. Only one in several million people possess this ability, and it cannot be learned, only awakened.

firstUseContext.description: Silvers Rayleigh unleashed Conqueror's Haki in the Human Auctioning House, instantly knocking unconscious most of the people present including Marines, pirates, and auction attendees.
firstUseContext.significance: This is the first explicit demonstration of Conqueror's Haki in the anime, introducing this rare and powerful ability.

knownUsers.notes: Demonstrated precise control by selectively knocking out specific individuals in the auction house

techniques.description: The user releases a wave of Conqueror's Haki that renders all nearby individuals with insufficient willpower unconscious.

reveals.information: A mysterious power called 'Haki' exists in the One Piece world
Conqueror's Haki can knock out multiple people simultaneously without physical contact

description: A form of Haki that allows the user to create an invisible armor around themselves and manipulate objects. Advanced users can emit their Haki and use it to affect objects without touching them.

firstUseContext.description: Silvers Rayleigh used advanced Armament Haki to safely remove Camie's explosive collar by carefully timing and controlling the detonation.
firstUseContext.significance: This demonstrates an advanced application of Armament Haki that won't be fully explained until much later in the series. It shows that Haki can be used for precise, delicate tasks beyond just combat.

knownUsers.notes: Demonstrated advanced emission technique to disarm an explosive collar

techniques.description: An advanced technique where the user can project their Haki outward to affect objects without direct contact, allowing for precise manipulation.

reveals.information: Advanced Armament Haki can be used to safely disarm explosive devices through precise control

description: A mysterious power that allows individuals to harness their spiritual energy and willpower for various abilities. The word 'Haki' is introduced by Hatchan when explaining Rayleigh's power.

firstMentionContext.description: Hatchan explains to the shocked onlookers that the mysterious power Rayleigh used is called 'Haki.' This is the first time the word 'Haki' is spoken in the One Piece anime.
firstMentionContext.significance: This moment officially introduces the term 'Haki' to the audience, establishing it as a fundamental power system in the One Piece world, separate from Devil Fruits.

reveals.information: The mysterious power demonstrated by powerful individuals is called 'Haki'
